instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD: What is SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD? SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a pre-requisite for SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK..

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message:
NOt sure why I have no fan spin on this 5V and 3v3 at the fan connector but Fan Rt PWm is 0V. Tried a different fan to make sure I wasn't getting trolled as I was thinking if I have VCORE there should be fan spin. 0V at L3095 DOes that rail need to be present for board to start?

Wondering if this is related to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> issue? 

I'm definitely confused.

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message:
TBT boost will not work until a thunderbolt device is detected.

Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message: Wonâ€™t start in smc bypass. Plt reset not present. No history but there was some corrosion near <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. Issue related to rom could prevent board starting? Correct?

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message:
Check SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Be sure no corrosion at J6100.

Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> goes high?

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message:
Was some stuff on and near <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> that I didn't notice prior so I'm glad you had me check that. Now I'm missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>. SMC bypass still won't start the board either. 

J6100 originally had stuff on it, that was one of the first things I addressed thinking that was going to solve it all haaha. Things look good now also around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. There was also corrosion at <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C6101</CAPACITOR> prior to my post here and both of those were replaced and traces around those have been checked.

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message: Tied together pins 5 & 6 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and test the board.

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message: I still had nothing on pin 3 but after changing <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> again it now is booting but still no fan spin haha

threads.title: 00165 no start/boot, VCORE present
threads.message: Heat, flux and a tap around pin 90 area of SMC and now boots AND fan spin. fuck this board
